public class AttributeCode
extends Attribute

Representation of a attribute_code of a method of a class.

1.0.0, 2010-03-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Constructor Detail

AttributeCode

public AttributeCode(ClassFile classFile,
                     int attributeNameIndex)
              throws ClassFileException,
                     java.io.IOException
Basic constructor.

Parameters:
classFile - The ClassFile the attribute belongs to.
attributeNameIndex - The index in the constant_pool that hold the attribute's name as a UTF8.
Throws:
ClassFileException - Thrown when parsing of sub attributes fails or an invalid index into the constant pool is ecnountered.
java.io.IOException - Thrown on errors reading from the DataInputStream of the class.

getInstructionsAndOtherBytes

public Instruction[] getInstructionsAndOtherBytes()
                                           throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Getter for the instructions and other bytes. This array can be used for execution, since jumping is much easier in this form.

Returns:
The instructions as an array of Instruction objects. Objects being null represent other bytes.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.

getInstructions

public Instruction[] getInstructions()
                              throws InvalidInstructionInitialisationException
Getter for the instructions.

Returns:
The instructions as an array of Instruction objects.
Throws:
InvalidInstructionInitialisationException - Any fatal problems with the parsing and the initialization will lead to this exception.

replaceInstruction

public void replaceInstruction(QuickInstruction quick,
                               int index)
Replace the instruction at index with the specified QuickIsntruction. This is a low level method and will neither check whether replacing instructions is granted, nor if the specified instruction is a suitable replacement.

Do not use this method before the instructions have been retrieved. It will not check for that and throw a NullPointerException!

Parameters:
quick - The QuickInstruction
index - The index into the instructions.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the index into the instructions is not suitable.
java.lang.NullPointerException - If quick is null.

resetReplacedInstructions

public void resetReplacedInstructions()
Reset replaced instruction to their original values (Instructions of type ReplacingInstruction. There is no reason to run this method unless an application has been executed, which might have lead to executions being replaced.

unloadInstructions

public void unloadInstructions()
Unload priorly cached instructions. The next times a instruction of the array of instructions is requested, the according byte codes are read the the instructions generated.

getNextCodeByte

public short getNextCodeByte()
                      throws NoMoreCodeBytesException
Get the next byte of the code. Warning: This method is only intended to by used by classes parsing and generating the current instructions after getInstructions() has been invoked.

Returns:
The next unsigned byte of the code as a short.
Throws:
NoMoreCodeBytesException - If the end of the code stream has been reached.

getNextCodeBytes

public short[] getNextCodeBytes(int number)
                         throws NoMoreCodeBytesException
Get the next bytes of the code. Warning: This method is only intended to by used by classes parsing and generating the current instructions after getInstructions() has been invoked.

Parameters:
number - The number of bytes to fetch.
Returns:
An array with unsigned bytes of the code as short-values.
Throws:
NoMoreCodeBytesException - If the end of the code stream has been reached, or 0 or less bytes have been requested.
